banner.title: An easy way to start investing
banner.text: ETFs are investment funds, shares (investment certificates) of which are traded on stock exchanges. The main advantages of ETFs:
banner.item1: Trading ETFs is as easy as trading stocks
banner.item2: The ability to quickly and easily independently create a diversified portfolio of securities
banner.item3: Lower fees than buying each share individually

cards.title: What are ETFs (Exchange Traded Funds)?
cards.text: ETFs are investment funds that are traded on an exchange and can include different asset classes, for example, stocks, bonds, foreign exchange instruments, commodity assets, etc.

card1.title: Diversification
card1.desc1: With one investment you purchase a ready-made basket of assets: from stocks and bonds to commodities and currencies.
card1.desc2: ETFs include different instruments and assets, allowing you to conveniently diversify investment risks.

card2.title: Save time
card2.desc1: Investments in ETFs do not require special knowledge or professional qualifications and are available to most private investors.
card2.desc2: ETFs allow you to invest in industries or indices that generate interest and confidence, without spending time researching the market and selecting assets.

card3.title: Liquidity
card3.desc1: Just like transactions with shares, transactions with ETFs can be made at any time the exchange is open.
card3.desc2: ETFs are convenient because their shares can be quickly sold and bought in the desired volume at a price acceptable to the investor.

card4.title: Potential Risks
card4.desc1: ETFs, like any other investment instrument, are subject to various types of risks, for example, regulatory risk, currency risk, tax risk, interest rate risk, etc.
card4.desc2: It is very important to understand these risks and evaluate them yourself.
